Subject: Maximal I aint
From: Jeremiah <rdahl@...>

Firedrill reaches the CR chambers. He looked inside, it was good to see
friends again. He was a bit uncertain of what to do now, considering he had
never been asked to join, and now they had forgoten, perhaps there is
another, more peace loving group, maybe he had these Maximals all wrong.
Maybe they were not the good guys, or at least not as good as he wanted to
associate with. He wasnt to impressed by some of the soldiers conduct
during peace talks, and the comanders distrust and short fuse. Then one of
the chambers announced it's completion. He rushed over to it with some
eagerness, and pressed the button for the release hatch. Out stumbled a
small blue and grey robot. Firedrill grabbed his shoulder to help stabilize
him. "Whoaaa, you okay Beachcomber" he asked hopefully. In an easy and
nonthreatening voice the robot awnsered.


"Yeahhhhh. My head's a bit sore, but I'll be okay, did you save me from
enemy fire?" he askes. "No, some Maximal did. He made a nice impression on
me, but he was the only one. I don't know if we belong here buddy" he
awnsered to the question. He then helped Beachcomber against a wall, so he
could lean against it, and shake off his pain. Firedrill then stared
intently on the last CR chamber, hoping for it to open, so they could maybe
leave.
